title: EPIC E1: Evaluation Foundation
acceptance_criteria: Baseline dataset lock file exists and is versioned | Per-commit and nightly metric jobs are defined | Baseline outputs are published as artifacts for comparison
description: Weeks 1-3. Establish deterministic datasets, baseline metrics, CI smoke checks, and dashboards used as hard release gates.

title: EPIC E2: Receipts + Proposal Workflow
acceptance_criteria: Proposal-only workflow exists for rename/type/comment mutations | Every auto-applied change includes a receipt | Rollback can restore previous state reliably
description: Weeks 2-6. Build receipt-first proposal flow with review/apply/rollback as the default mutation path.

title: EPIC E3: Capability Guard + Policy Modes
acceptance_criteria: All tool invocations are capability-checked | Policy mode enforcement is test-covered | Security regressions block release
description: Weeks 2-7. Enforce capability-scoped execution and policy modes (offline, allowlist, cloud) with auditability.

title: EPIC E4: Local Semantic Search
acceptance_criteria: Local index builds from analyzed artifacts | Semantic search UI is usable in-plugin | Recall/latency gates are enforced
description: Weeks 4-8. Deliver local indexing, similarity retrieval, and intent-level search with measurable quality/latency gains.

title: EPIC E5: Triage Crew v1
acceptance_criteria: Triage mission graph is deterministic | Mission output is artifactized and reviewable | Hotspot recall target is measured
description: Weeks 7-10. Ship deterministic triage mission that outputs map, hotspots, unknowns, and evidence references.

title: EPIC E6: Type PR Lifecycle v1
acceptance_criteria: Type assertions persist with lifecycle metadata | Review UI supports approve/reject/change requests | Propagation and conflict handling are implemented
description: Weeks 8-11. Add type assertions lifecycle (proposed->reviewed->accepted->propagated) and reviewer workflows.

title: EPIC E7: Corpus Sync Pilot
acceptance_criteria: Approved-only sync path exists | Provenance chain survives sync | Cross-binary reuse can be pulled back into local analysis
description: Weeks 10-12. Sync approved artifacts to shared corpus with provenance and access-control enforcement.

title: EPIC E8: Hardening + Release Candidate
acceptance_criteria: Full regression suite passes | Security signoff completed | Exit-gate report and go/no-go decision recorded
description: Weeks 11-12. Run full regression/soak, complete security signoff, and produce release candidate decision package.

title: EPIC R1: Roadmap Completion Remediation
acceptance_criteria: All reopened critical stories are closed with reproducible evidence | Kernel preflight/gates demonstrate executable quality checks, not placeholder checks | Final go/no-go artifact reflects real benchmark/security outcomes
description: Post-review remediation epic to close factual, integration, and release-readiness gaps found in strict audit.

title: EPIC E13: Real-Target Benchmark Program GA
acceptance_criteria: E13-S1 through E13-S6 complete with reproducible commands and signed evidence artifacts | Benchmark manifests include license/provenance controls and architecture coverage evidence | Trend dashboard artifacts publish measurable quality, latency, and human-time lift deltas over baseline
description: Post-E12 benchmark hardening epic focused on real-target corpus quality, architecture breadth, calibration rigor, human-time productivity measurement, and signed benchmark release operations.

title: EPIC E14: Native Reverend Pluginization
acceptance_criteria: E14-S1 through E14-S6 deliver native plugin contracts and operational cockpit flows | All proposal/mission actions are transaction-safe and policy-controlled | Headless and UI runs produce equivalent outputs on deterministic fixtures
description: Post-E12 pluginization epic to embed Reverend capabilities directly in Ghidra workflows with transaction safety, cockpit UX, and headless/UI parity.

title: EPIC E15: Decompiler-Native Type/Structure Intelligence
acceptance_criteria: E15-S1 through E15-S6 deliver decompiler-native type reasoning with auditable hypotheses | Cross-function and cross-binary propagation are policy-aware and provenance-linked | Benchmark pack demonstrates measurable accuracy lift vs baseline decompiler output
description: Post-E14 type-system epic focused on SSA/alias-derived inference, struct conflict proofs, vtable reconstruction, propagation v3, and benchmarked quality lift.

title: EPIC E16: Dynamic/Symbolic/Taint Evidence Fabric
acceptance_criteria: E16-S1 through E16-S6 produce one normalized dynamic evidence model across trace families | Cockpit and API layers support temporal, symbolic, taint, and crash/coverage evidence operations | Replay packs reproduce incident findings deterministically from pinned artifacts
description: Post-E14 runtime evidence epic focused on unified ingest, taint/constraint overlays, temporal querying, and deterministic replay for incident-grade workflows.

title: EPIC E17: Corpus Platform GA + Team Scale
acceptance_criteria: E17-S1 through E17-S6 complete with measurable integrity, latency, and tenancy controls | Corpus platform supports resilient recovery drills and capacity-tested operations | 10-to-100 analyst load profile is validated with documented SLO boundaries
description: Post-E16 platform epic focused on CAS integrity, receipt replication, sharded low-latency retrieval, tenancy hardening, and analyst-scale load validation.

title: EPIC E18: Zero-Trust Agent Runtime
acceptance_criteria: E18-S1 through E18-S6 enforce zero-trust controls across runtime, policy, and artifact execution paths | Adversarial suites validate guardrails against prompt/binary-driven bypass attempts | Security posture scorecards and remediation hooks are automated and reproducible
description: Post-E17 security epic focused on OS-level sandboxing, short-lived credentials, egress DLP, signed attestation, adversarial testing, and posture automation.

title: EPIC E19: Patching + Exploitability Workbench
acceptance_criteria: E19-S1 through E19-S6 provide end-to-end remediation decision workflows from evidence to patch rollout | Exploitability and patch correctness outputs are benchmarked and reproducible | Decision packets include red/blue tradeoffs, signoffs, and rollout checkpoints
description: Post-E18 remediation epic focused on rewrite interop, exploitability scoring, PoC replay safety, patch correctness validation, vulnerability hunt DSL, and red/blue rollout packets.

title: EPIC E20: Audit Closure + Delivery Integrity
acceptance_criteria: Findings F1-F9 are closed with reproducible evidence and no open severity-high regressions | Gate/CI stack blocks regressions across Reverend plus frontier module scope | Kernel completion integrity controls prevent silent zero-diff closes without explicit policy justification
description: Audit-driven closure epic that resolves all findings from the 2026-02-22 comprehensive review across compile health, gate coverage, runtime wiring, roadmap consistency, and kernel completion integrity.

title: EPIC E21: SOTA Assistant Operationalization
acceptance_criteria: Query, evidence, and mission workflows are operational inside Ghidra on representative binaries | Performance and quality gates prove improvement over current heuristic baseline | GA packet includes reproducible commands, artifacts, and local operator runbook
description: Operationalization epic that turns Reverend into an end-to-end in-Ghidra assistant with indexed retrieval, evidence-backed ranking, mission integration, and benchmark-gated release criteria.

title: E1-S1: Pin datasets and stand up deterministic evaluation harness
acceptance_criteria: A locked dataset manifest exists with reproducible versions/checksums | Evaluation entrypoints run in a clean environment without manual steps | Seed and environment controls are documented and enforced
description: Type: Story. Epic: E1. Build dataset lock and baseline harness plumbing for similarity/type/diff metrics.

title: E1-S2: Add per-commit smoke metrics and nightly regression pipeline
acceptance_criteria: Per-commit smoke job publishes metric artifacts | Nightly regression run compares against previous baseline | Failures are surfaced as blocking signals
description: Type: Story. Epic: E1. Wire CI jobs for smoke metrics and nightly full regression comparisons.

title: E1-S3: Run and publish stock baselines for semantic search and type recovery
acceptance_criteria: Baseline run covers selected benchmark slices | Results are versioned and traceable to code/dataset revisions | Baseline summary is accessible to all lanes
description: Type: Story. Epic: E1. Measure stock baseline metrics and publish comparator artifacts. Implementation scope: .github/workflows/eval.yaml + eval/* scripts; avoid broad docs-only changes.

title: E1-S4: Build metrics dashboard and alert thresholds for MVP gates
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard shows current and trending values for all MVP exit gates | Threshold breaches trigger actionable alerts | Dashboard data is reproducible from saved artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: E1. Provide dashboard and alerting for recall/latency/receipt/rollback gates.

title: E2-S1: Implement receipt schema and append-only receipt store
acceptance_criteria: Receipt schema supports actor/action/target/evidence linkage | Append-only writes are enforced for receipt history | Receipt integrity verification detects tampering
description: Type: Story. Epic: E2. Introduce core receipt persistence model and hash-chain integrity semantics.

title: E2-S2: Build proposal state machine and review/apply API
acceptance_criteria: Review actions are accepted only in UNDER_REVIEW state; direct OPEN approvals/rejections are rejected | Invalid lifecycle attempts raise InvalidStateTransitionException with state details | Unit tests prove OPEN->UNDER_REVIEW->APPROVED path and fail direct OPEN->APPROVED behavior
description: Type: Story. Epic: E2. REOPEN: enforce strict proposal lifecycle invariants in Java; remove OPEN->APPROVED shortcut and align service/tests to documented transition model.

title: E2-S3: Implement transaction-safe apply and rollback adapter
acceptance_criteria: Apply operation records transaction + receipt linkage | Rollback restores pre-apply state for batch and single changes | Automated rollback tests pass for representative scenarios
description: Type: Story. Epic: E2. Wire approved proposals to transactional apply/undo semantics.

title: E2-S4: Capture and render evidence links for every proposal
acceptance_criteria: Evidence references are stored with stable identifiers | Review UI can inspect evidence per proposal | Evidence remains intact after apply and rollback
description: Type: Story. Epic: E2. Persist xrefs/constants/callsites evidence and display in review UI.

title: E3-S1: Enforce capability-token guard on all agent/tool operations
acceptance_criteria: Every tool entrypoint validates capability token before action | Denied operations fail closed with explicit reason | Capability checks are covered by unit tests
description: Type: Story. Epic: E3. Implement capability checks for read/write/execute surfaces.

title: E3-S2: Implement policy modes and endpoint allowlist enforcement
acceptance_criteria: All outbound runtime paths pass through policy enforcement layer before network access | offline/allowlist/cloud mode behavior is validated by integration tests against real call paths | Policy enforcement artifacts referenced by bead context exist in-repo and are executable
description: Type: Story. Epic: E3. REOPEN: wire policy modes/allowlist enforcement at runtime entrypoints instead of unit-only surfaces; ensure context artifacts are real and reproducible.

title: E3-S3: Add permission audit logs and violation incident records
acceptance_criteria: Security-relevant runtime actions emit audit events with actor/time/target/policy metadata | Policy violations create incident records with mitigation action and traceable evidence | Integration tests verify audit query/export paths from end-to-end workflow execution
description: Type: Story. Epic: E3. REOPEN: connect permission audit and violation incident records to actual denied/allowed runtime actions with export/query coverage.

title: E3-S4: Build security regression suite for no-direct-agent-write invariant
acceptance_criteria: Regression suite covers direct and indirect write paths | Failing security tests block merges | Invariant reports are attached to CI artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: E3. Add tests that prove agent cannot mutate canonical state directly.

title: E4-S1: Implement local embedding pipeline and similarity adapter baseline
acceptance_criteria: Pipeline creates searchable vectors/features for target corpus slice | Baseline retrieval API returns deterministic top-k results | Pipeline runtime and index build stats are recorded
description: Type: Story. Epic: E4. Build local indexing/embedding ingestion path and baseline retrieval adapter.

title: E4-S2: Deliver semantic search query service and in-tool search panel
acceptance_criteria: Search service supports intent query and similar-function query | UI displays ranked results with provenance/evidence references | Search interactions are instrumented for latency metrics
description: Type: Story. Epic: E4. Expose intent/similarity queries to analysts through plugin UI.

title: E4-S3: Add evidence-weighted reranking for semantic results
acceptance_criteria: Reranker consumes evidence-derived features | Result ordering improves against baseline on eval slice | Fallback path exists if reranker is unavailable
description: Type: Story. Epic: E4. Improve ranking quality using receipts/evidence-derived signals.

title: E4-S4: Meet semantic search recall/latency gates at MVP scale
acceptance_criteria: p95 search latency meets defined gate on target corpus size | Recall@10 improves by target delta versus stock baseline | Benchmark report is reproducible from CI artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: E4. Tune indexing/query path to hit p95 latency and recall targets.

title: E5-S1: Implement deterministic triage mission graph and feature extractor
acceptance_criteria: Triage mission runs through deterministic stage graph | Mission emits entrypoints/hotspots/unknowns with evidence refs | Mission execution summary is persisted as artifact
description: Type: Story. Epic: E5. Build triage crew mission pipeline with fixed stages and evidence hooks.

title: E5-S2: Add triage mission UI and exportable report artifacts
acceptance_criteria: Analyst can inspect triage map and ranked hotspots in UI | Mission outputs export to versionable artifact format | Evidence links are navigable from report to source context
description: Type: Story. Epic: E5. Render mission outputs in-plugin and export machine-readable summaries.

title: E5-S3: Calibrate triage scoring against curated benchmark set
acceptance_criteria: Curated triage benchmark set is versioned | Scoring calibration improves key metrics to target threshold | Calibration changes are documented with before/after results
description: Type: Story. Epic: E5. Measure and tune triage precision/recall against curated labeled corpus.

title: E6-S1: Persist type assertions with lifecycle metadata
acceptance_criteria: Type assertions persist target, source, confidence, and state | Lifecycle transitions are validated server-side | Type assertions link to receipt and evidence records
description: Type: Story. Epic: E6. Implement storage model for type assertions and lifecycle states.

title: E6-S2: Build Type PR review panel and workflow actions
acceptance_criteria: Type PR list/detail views are available in plugin UI | Review actions update lifecycle state atomically | Reviewer comments and rationale are persisted
description: Type: Story. Epic: E6. Add reviewer UI for type proposal packs with approve/reject/change requests.

title: E6-S3: Implement type propagation and conflict-resolution mechanics
acceptance_criteria: Accepted types propagate according to configured scope rules | Conflicts surface with deterministic resolution workflow | Propagation can be rolled back cleanly
description: Type: Story. Epic: E6. Propagate accepted types and handle competing assertions safely.

title: E6-S4: Add type suggestion generator with confidence thresholds
acceptance_criteria: Suggestions include confidence and evidence summary | Low-confidence suggestions are quarantined by policy | Suggestion quality metrics are collected in CI
description: Type: Story. Epic: E6. Generate type suggestions with confidence scoring and threshold policy.

title: E7-S1: Build approved-only corpus sync worker
acceptance_criteria: Sync worker filters out non-approved proposals | Sync jobs are idempotent and resumable | Sync telemetry includes counts/errors/latency
description: Type: Story. Epic: E7. Sync only approved artifacts from local store to shared corpus backend.

title: E7-S2: Enforce provenance and access controls on corpus sync/read paths
acceptance_criteria: Synced artifacts retain complete provenance chain | Access control checks are enforced on sync and retrieval | Unauthorized requests are denied and audited
description: Type: Story. Epic: E7. Require provenance continuity and policy checks for shared corpus operations.

title: E7-S3: Implement cross-binary reuse and pullback into local analysis session
acceptance_criteria: Cross-binary match retrieval works from local session | Reused artifacts are inserted as proposals with receipts | Analyst can accept/reject pulled suggestions in normal review flow
description: Type: Story. Epic: E7. Query corpus for reusable names/types/annotations and apply as proposals locally.

title: E8-S1: Run full regression and soak test, fix release-blocking bottlenecks
acceptance_criteria: Regression suite includes executable Java/Python gates (not diff-only placeholders) | JDK21 toolchain is enforced in CI for Gradle test execution on affected modules | Soak and regression results are published with explicit blocking failures and resolutions/waivers
description: Type: Story. Epic: E8. REOPEN: execute full regression/soak on real gates and JDK21-capable toolchain; resolve or waiver release-blocking failures with evidence.

title: E8-S2: Execute adversarial abuse scenarios and complete security signoff
acceptance_criteria: Abuse scenario suite artifact exists in repo and is executable/reviewable | Scenario outcomes include pass/fail, observed controls, and remediation for failures | Security signoff is documented with approver, date, and unresolved-risk notes
description: Type: Story. Epic: E8. REOPEN: execute adversarial abuse scenarios against enforced policy/runtime paths and produce signed security signoff evidence.

title: E8-S3: Package release candidate and publish operator/reviewer runbook
acceptance_criteria: Release candidate is packaged with versioned changelog | Runbook covers setup, review flow, rollback, and incident handling | Known limitations are explicitly documented
description: Type: Story. Epic: E8. Produce installable RC and operational docs for analysts/reviewers/operators.

title: E8-S4: Produce MVP exit-gate report and final go/no-go decision artifact
acceptance_criteria: Exit-gate packet maps each gate to measurable evidence artifact and status | Open risks/waivers include owner, rationale, and expiration/revisit conditions | Go/no-go decision record includes approvers and dated final determination
description: Type: Story. Epic: E8. REOPEN: publish final MVP exit-gate packet with explicit pass/fail table, waivers, residual risks, and go/no-go decision provenance.

title: R1-S1: Restore beads/preflight integrity for strict reproducible dispatch
acceptance_criteria: scripts/cyntra/preflight.sh passes in strict mode with no missing context files | All issue context_files point to existing repository paths | No dependency edges reference unknown issue IDs
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Reconcile context files and bead metadata so strict preflight succeeds without bypass flags.

title: R1-S2: Replace placeholder Cyntra gates with executable build/test gates
acceptance_criteria: Cyntra test/typecheck/lint gate commands execute substantive checks tied to roadmap quality | Gate failures block issue completion when Java/Python checks fail | Gate docs and config show exact commands and expected artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Upgrade gate commands from diff/context sanity checks to real compile/test/eval checks.

title: R1-S3: Add JDK21/toolchain guardrails for local + CI reproducibility
acceptance_criteria: Preflight or bootstrap reports actionable failure when JDK21 is unavailable | CI workflow explicitly provisions compatible Java and Python versions | Developer runbook documents local setup and verification command set
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Ensure required Java/Python toolchain versions are validated before running heavy gates/workflows.

title: R1-S4: Run non-toy benchmark slice and publish reproducible delta report
acceptance_criteria: At least one non-toy benchmark dataset slice is materialized and executed end-to-end | Metrics report compares stock baseline vs current implementation with reproducible commands | Known limitations and confidence bounds are explicitly documented
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Replace toy-only confidence with at least one representative non-toy benchmark run and documented deltas.

title: R1-S5: Wire proposal/security services into real runtime entrypoints with integration tests
acceptance_criteria: Capability/policy/proposal flows are invoked from runtime entrypoints used by mission workflows | Integration tests validate end-to-end behavior beyond class-level unit tests | Receipt/audit evidence is emitted from integrated paths
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Move new security/proposal components from isolated unit surfaces into actual runtime/plugin call paths.

title: R1-S6: Build and execute abuse-scenario suite artifact
acceptance_criteria: docs/security/abuse-scenario-suite.md exists with executable scenarios and expected controls | Each scenario includes observed outcome, evidence link, and remediation note if failed | Results are referenced by reopened security signoff story
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Create the missing abuse-scenario suite doc/artifacts and run it against current controls.

title: R1-S7: Reconcile backlog/runbook status surfaces with bead truth
acceptance_criteria: docs/backlog-jira-linear.csv statuses match .beads/issues.jsonl statuses | docs/cyntra-kernel-runbook.md reflects current epic/story state semantics | A repeatable export/sync command is documented
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Eliminate status drift between beads, CSV export, and operational runbook docs.

title: R1-S8: Publish MVP exit-gate packet with waiver registry and go/no-go record
acceptance_criteria: Exit-gate packet lists every gate with evidence artifact path and pass/fail/waived status | Waiver registry includes owner, justification, and review date | Go/no-go record includes date, approvers, and final rationale
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Produce final decision packet grounded in reopened regression/security/benchmark evidence.

title: R1-S9: Clean merge-conflict shadow beads and harden merge-path behavior
acceptance_criteria: Merge-conflict shadow issues are resolved into canonical issue history without duplicate execution targets | Kernel merge path no longer generates recursive [MERGE CONFLICT] issue chains | Runbook documents deterministic merge-failure recovery steps
description: Type: Story. Epic: R1. Resolve/retire generated merge-conflict bead artifacts and prevent recursive conflict bead creation.

title: E13-S1: OSS binary corpus ingestion + license/provenance manifesting
acceptance_criteria: Corpus ingest emits manifest rows with checksum, source, SPDX, arch, compiler metadata, and acquisition timestamp | License policy rejects unsupported/unknown classes with explicit failure evidence | Ingest is reproducible from pinned manifest inputs and command logs
description: Type: Story. Epic: E13. Build deterministic ingestion for real-target OSS binaries with locked provenance and license policy enforcement.

title: E13-S2: Ground-truth curation tooling for similarity/type/diff tasks
acceptance_criteria: Curator tooling supports reviewer assignment, disagreement capture, and adjudication state | Exports are consumable by eval scripts without manual transforms | Dataset split stability checks detect label drift across reruns
description: Type: Story. Epic: E13. Implement adjudicated ground-truth tooling for similarity, type recovery, and diff tasks with reviewer attribution.

title: E13-S3: Architecture coverage pack (x86_64/ARM64/MIPS/RISCV/PPC)
acceptance_criteria: Architecture slices exist for x86_64, ARM64, MIPS, RISCV, and PPC with manifest checksums | Eval harness reports per-architecture metrics and missing-slice failures | Coverage thresholds are enforced as blocking gates
description: Type: Story. Epic: E13. Expand benchmark coverage to five architectures and enforce minimum per-architecture sample quality gates.

title: E13-S4: OOD score + confidence calibration gates
acceptance_criteria: OOD detector outputs per-sample and aggregate risk scores with deterministic thresholds | Calibration metrics (ECE/Brier or equivalent) are computed and trended | Gate fails when calibration/OOD thresholds are exceeded
description: Type: Story. Epic: E13. Add out-of-distribution scoring and confidence calibration gates for retrieval, type, and diff outputs.

title: E13-S5: Human-time-to-answer benchmark harness
acceptance_criteria: Harness produces reproducible timed tasks and deterministic scoring rubric | Outputs include time-to-first-correct and time-to-mergeable-proposal metrics | Results are exportable to trend dashboard inputs
description: Type: Story. Epic: E13. Build analyst-time productivity harness for task completion, correction rate, and review latency metrics.

title: E13-S6: Signed benchmark release pack + trend dashboard
acceptance_criteria: Release pack contains manifest, checksums, scorecards, and changelog signed with traceable provenance | Dashboard inputs are machine-readable and versioned per run | Nightly and per-commit trend deltas are reproducible from artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: E13. Publish signed benchmark packs and trend dashboard artifacts for RC-to-GA quality tracking.

title: E14-S1: Create Features/Reverend plugin module and service contracts
acceptance_criteria: Plugin module skeleton compiles in Gradle and exposes explicit service interfaces | Service API contracts are versioned and documented | Integration points to existing security/proposal primitives are validated
description: Type: Story. Epic: E14. Stand up native plugin module and versioned service contracts for query, proposal, evidence, mission, and policy surfaces.

title: E14-S2: Bind semantic query engine to live Program/Decompiler state
acceptance_criteria: Queries resolve against active Program and decompiler context without stale state leakage | Cache invalidation paths are covered for reanalysis/symbol updates | Latency and error telemetry are emitted for query operations
description: Type: Story. Epic: E14. Connect semantic query services to live Program, symbol, and decompiler state with deterministic refresh semantics.

title: E14-S3: Cockpit v2 dockable providers with jump-to-evidence actions
acceptance_criteria: Dockable provider surfaces semantic results, evidence facets, and confidence metadata | Jump-to-address/xref/proposal actions work from cockpit views | UI state is serializable and restorable across sessions
description: Type: Story. Epic: E14. Implement dockable cockpit providers for search, evidence drilldown, and graph facets with direct navigation actions.

title: E14-S4: Transaction-safe apply/revert wired to Ghidra undo stack
acceptance_criteria: Apply and revert actions participate in atomic Ghidra transactions | Undo/redo behavior remains consistent for batch and single-item operations | Receipt/audit links survive apply and rollback paths
description: Type: Story. Epic: E14. Wire proposal apply/revert lifecycle into transaction boundaries and undo/redo semantics.

title: E14-S5: Headless/UI parity harness for mission and proposal flows
acceptance_criteria: Parity harness runs deterministic fixtures in headless and UI modes | Differences are emitted as structured diffs with failure thresholds | Parity evidence is published in CI and local gate reports
description: Type: Story. Epic: E14. Build parity harness that proves mission/proposal outputs are equivalent between headless and UI execution modes.

title: E14-S6: Operator settings + policy controls in-tool
acceptance_criteria: Policy mode and threshold settings are persisted and audited | Role-based restrictions apply to high-risk settings changes | UI and headless settings paths stay behaviorally consistent
description: Type: Story. Epic: E14. Add in-tool controls for policy mode, confidence thresholds, and operational safety limits.

title: E15-S1: SSA + alias feature extractor from decompiler IR
acceptance_criteria: Extractor outputs stable feature vectors keyed by function and analysis revision | SSA/alias coverage metrics are published for benchmark slices | Feature schema includes versioning for backward compatibility
description: Type: Story. Epic: E15. Build deterministic SSA/alias feature extraction for type inference and conflict analysis pipelines.

title: E15-S2: Struct layout solver with conflict proofs
acceptance_criteria: Solver returns candidate layouts with confidence and conflicting constraint traces | Conflict proofs are attached to proposals for reviewer inspection | Regression suite covers padding, unions, pointer arithmetic, and ambiguous fields
description: Type: Story. Epic: E15. Implement solver-based struct layout inference with machine-readable conflict and unsat proofs.

title: E15-S3: Vtable/interface reconstruction across callgraph
acceptance_criteria: Vtable candidates include slot ordering, method sets, and confidence rationale | Interface hypotheses can be reviewed and accepted/rejected as proposals | Cross-compiler fixtures validate robustness across target families
description: Type: Story. Epic: E15. Reconstruct vtables and interface hypotheses across callgraph neighborhoods with confidence and provenance metadata.

title: E15-S4: Cross-function and cross-binary type propagation v3
acceptance_criteria: Accepted types propagate across call boundaries with rollback-safe apply semantics | Cross-binary transfer respects policy mode and artifact lineage checks | Propagation conflicts are scored and surfaced with reviewer actions
description: Type: Story. Epic: E15. Deliver propagation v3 with interprocedural and cross-binary transfer under policy and provenance constraints.

title: E15-S5: Alternate-hypothesis ranking for uncertain types
acceptance_criteria: Top-k hypothesis ranking includes per-signal score contributions | Reviewer UX displays alternatives and confidence deltas | Calibration report demonstrates rank ordering quality under uncertainty
description: Type: Story. Epic: E15. Rank alternate type hypotheses and expose evidence-weighted rationale for uncertainty-aware review.

title: E15-S6: Type accuracy benchmark pack vs baseline decompiler output
acceptance_criteria: Benchmark pack reports precision/recall/F1 by type family and architecture | Results are reproducible from locked datasets and seed controls | Scorecard includes confidence intervals and residual-risk notes
description: Type: Story. Epic: E15. Publish benchmark pack comparing Reverend type inference and baseline decompiler type outputs across architectures.

title: E16-S1: Normalized ingest for debugger, Frida, QEMU trace formats
acceptance_criteria: Adapter layer supports at least three trace formats under one versioned schema | Schema includes deterministic IDs linking runtime events to static entities | Replay fixtures verify parser determinism and schema compatibility
description: Type: Story. Epic: E16. Build normalized event ingest adapters for debugger, Frida, and QEMU trace streams.

title: E16-S2: Taint evidence schema + ingest adapters
acceptance_criteria: Taint schema supports source, sink, propagation edge, and confidence metadata | At least one dynamic taint adapter imports into normalized evidence store | Taint records are queryable by function, variable, and timeline filters
description: Type: Story. Epic: E16. Add taint evidence schema and adapters that preserve source/sink/propagation semantics with provenance links.

title: E16-S3: Constraint/counterexample replay overlays in cockpit
acceptance_criteria: Cockpit shows branch/path constraints with jump-to-code navigation | Counterexample replay is deterministic and receipt-linked | UI/headless parity tests validate overlay consistency
description: Type: Story. Epic: E16. Surface symbolic constraints and counterexamples as replayable cockpit overlays tied to code entities.

title: E16-S4: Coverage/crash evidence auto-link to static entities
acceptance_criteria: Coverage/crash ingest maps events to stable static IDs | Hotspot ranking consumes linked runtime evidence | Regression suite validates mapping quality on pinned fixtures
description: Type: Story. Epic: E16. Auto-link coverage and crash evidence from dynamic runs to static functions, blocks, and data entities.

title: E16-S5: Temporal query API over static+dynamic evidence graph
acceptance_criteria: API supports bounded time-window queries, event joins, and before/after relations | Query responses include provenance, confidence, and deterministic ordering | Performance report meets target latency budget on benchmark corpus
description: Type: Story. Epic: E16. Expose temporal query APIs over merged static and runtime evidence planes.

title: E16-S6: Deterministic replay artifacts for incident reproduction
acceptance_criteria: Replay bundles include traces, constraints, taint snapshots, and expected outputs | Replays are reproducible across clean environments using pinned manifests | Incident packet format is signed and integrity-verifiable
description: Type: Story. Epic: E16. Package deterministic replay artifacts for reproducible incident analysis and verification.

title: E17-S1: Content-addressable artifact storage and integrity verification
acceptance_criteria: All synced artifacts are addressed by content hash and verified on read/write | Integrity mismatches fail closed and create auditable incidents | Migration path exists for existing non-CAS artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: E17. Implement CAS-backed storage and end-to-end integrity verification for synced corpus artifacts.

title: E17-S2: Receipt replication/compaction and recovery drills
acceptance_criteria: Replicated receipt chains maintain continuity and tamper detection | Compaction preserves verification semantics and replayability | Recovery drills publish RTO/RPO metrics and failure analysis
description: Type: Story. Epic: E17. Add receipt replication and compaction with periodic recovery drills and continuity validation.

title: E17-S3: Sharded index service + cache layer for low-latency retrieval
acceptance_criteria: Sharded retrieval service supports scale-out with shard health telemetry | Cache layer defines eviction, consistency, and stale-read policies | Benchmark report includes p95/p99 latency under mixed workloads
description: Type: Story. Epic: E17. Build shard-aware retrieval and caching stack with latency and staleness budgets.

title: E17-S4: Negative-example sync (rejected proposals) for model hardening
acceptance_criteria: Rejected proposals sync path includes anonymization and attribution safeguards | Negative examples are queryable by reason class and decision metadata | Hardening eval demonstrates measurable improvement on rejection-prone cases
description: Type: Story. Epic: E17. Sync rejected proposals as policy-safe negative examples to improve retrieval and ranking robustness.

title: E17-S5: Multi-tenant ACL + SSO + audit-attribution hardening
acceptance_criteria: Tenant boundaries enforce RBAC/ABAC rules for all corpus and proposal operations | SSO claims map deterministically to tenant and role assignments | Audit trails preserve actor attribution for cross-tenant actions
description: Type: Story. Epic: E17. Harden multi-tenant access control and identity attribution with SSO-integrated audit trails.

title: E17-S6: 10->100 analyst load/soak validation
acceptance_criteria: Load/soak campaign includes realistic workload composition and failure injection | Capacity report publishes throughput, latency, and saturation boundaries | Operational tuning guidance is documented from measured bottlenecks
description: Type: Story. Epic: E17. Run scale validation from 10 to 100 analysts with mixed query/review/sync workloads.

title: E18-S1: Process-level sandbox runner (seccomp/AppArmor/macOS profile)
acceptance_criteria: Sandbox profiles are enforced for Linux and macOS execution paths | Forbidden filesystem/network/process actions fail closed with audit events | Policy tests cover profile fallback and misconfiguration paths
description: Type: Story. Epic: E18. Implement OS-level sandbox runner abstraction with deny-by-default profiles for tool execution.

title: E18-S2: Short-lived creds + key rotation control plane
acceptance_criteria: Credentials are issued with TTL and scoped permissions | Rotation and revocation workflows are automated and logged | Failure tests cover expired, revoked, and replayed credentials
description: Type: Story. Epic: E18. Add credential control plane for short-lived tokens, automated rotation, revocation, and auditability.

title: E18-S3: Egress DLP budget + deterministic redaction filters
acceptance_criteria: DLP policy supports category and byte-budget enforcement per mission/tenant | Redaction filters are deterministic and replay-verifiable | Violations trigger auditable incidents and gate failures
description: Type: Story. Epic: E18. Enforce egress DLP budgets and deterministic redaction for mission traffic and model prompts/responses.

title: E18-S4: Signed plugin/model attestation enforcement
acceptance_criteria: Unsigned or revoked artifacts are blocked before execution | Attestation checks include provenance metadata and policy mode constraints | Audit logs capture decision reason and artifact identity
description: Type: Story. Epic: E18. Enforce signature and provenance attestation for plugin/model artifacts before runtime execution.

title: E18-S5: Adversarial prompt/binary test suite expansion
acceptance_criteria: Suite includes new prompt and binary adversarial cases with expected control outcomes | Scenarios run in CI/local gates with pass/fail thresholds | Results include mitigation mapping and residual-risk notes
description: Type: Story. Epic: E18. Expand adversarial suites for prompt injection, payloaded binaries, and policy bypass attempts.

title: E18-S6: Security posture scorecard and auto-remediation hooks
acceptance_criteria: Scorecard aggregates sandbox, credential, DLP, and attestation control health | Auto-remediation hooks can revoke credentials and tighten policy mode safely | Posture reports are reproducible and release-pack compatible
description: Type: Story. Epic: E18. Publish posture scorecards and wire automated remediation hooks for critical runtime violations.

title: E19-S1: Binary rewrite proposal adapter (GTIRB/e9patch interop)
acceptance_criteria: Adapters emit deterministic patch proposal format and receipt links | Interop supports at least GTIRB and e9patch pathways | Apply/revert semantics remain transaction-safe
description: Type: Story. Epic: E19. Build rewrite proposal adapters for GTIRB/e9patch flows with reversible patch specs and provenance receipts.

title: E19-S2: Exploitability scoring from static+dynamic evidence
acceptance_criteria: Scoring model exposes feature-level contributions and uncertainty bounds | Scores are reproducible on pinned incident/benchmark slices | Ranking quality is benchmarked against baseline triage heuristics
description: Type: Story. Epic: E19. Build exploitability scoring using merged static, dynamic, taint, and environment evidence signals.

title: E19-S3: PoC template generation with sandboxed replay
acceptance_criteria: PoC templates include required environment assumptions and safety metadata | Replay execution is restricted to sandbox profiles with full audit logging | Generated templates are linked to exploitability evidence and confidence
description: Type: Story. Epic: E19. Generate constrained PoC templates and validate them only within sandboxed replay environments.

title: E19-S4: Patch correctness validation harness
acceptance_criteria: Harness validates semantic behavior against baseline traces/tests | Safety checks include crash regression and policy compliance assertions | Results publish machine-readable and markdown scorecards
description: Type: Story. Epic: E19. Build validation harness for semantic correctness and safety regression checks on proposed patches.

title: E19-S5: Vulnerability query DSL + saved hunt packs
acceptance_criteria: DSL supports composable predicates for vulnerability-relevant static/dynamic signals | Saved hunts are versioned, shareable, and tenant-aware | Query results are reproducible with explicit manifest and policy context
description: Type: Story. Epic: E19. Implement vulnerability query DSL and shareable hunt packs backed by corpus evidence and provenance.

title: E19-S6: Red/Blue decision packet workflow for remediation rollout
acceptance_criteria: Decision packet captures exploitability deltas, patch options, and rollout risk | Workflow includes owner signoff, waiver notes, and rollback plans | Packet artifacts are reproducible and linked to benchmark/security evidence
description: Type: Story. Epic: E19. Build remediation decision workflow combining red exploit evidence and blue patch options with controlled rollout checkpoints.

title: E20-S1: Restore Reverend compile/test baseline in active tree
acceptance_criteria: :Reverend:compileJava passes in active tree without local hacks | :Reverend:test --tests "ghidra.reverend.*" passes | Fix includes regression test or static assertion preventing icon/API regressions
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Fix active-tree Reverend compile blockers and establish a deterministic compile/test baseline for plugin scope.

title: E20-S2: Expand gate/CI compile coverage beyond Generic
acceptance_criteria: scripts/cyntra/gates.sh blocks on Reverend and selected frontier module compile failures | .github/workflows/eval.yaml includes blocking compile/test checks for added module scope | Gate output explicitly reports module coverage executed versus skipped
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Extend local gates and CI workflows so Reverend/frontier module compile breaks fail fast instead of shipping undetected.

title: E20-S3: Replace cockpit stub fallback with production service wiring
acceptance_criteria: Cockpit plugin initializes live service implementations by default | Runtime path exposes non-empty query/evidence behavior on fixture programs | Service bootstrap and lifecycle are covered by tests (init, bind, dispose)
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Remove empty-result stub defaults and wire cockpit providers to live query/evidence/proposal services in module initialization.

title: E20-S4: Make Python gate path dependency-self-contained
acceptance_criteria: bash scripts/cyntra/gates.sh --mode=all runs Python suites without ModuleNotFoundError | Test runner choice (`unittest` vs `pytest`) is explicit and consistent in gate scripts | Dependency declaration is pinned/documented for reproducible local and CI runs
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Eliminate `pytest` import failure in `unittest` discovery path by aligning test style and declared dependencies.

title: E20-S5: Resolve integrated-branch compile blockers before sync
acceptance_criteria: TraceModeling taint evidence classes compile cleanly with explicit DB codec handling | Semantic cockpit API signature mismatches are fixed and tests pass | Sync checklist includes compile verification in both active and integrated worktrees
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Fix known compile blockers identified in integrated merge path so mainline sync does not reintroduce latent failures.

title: E20-S6: Replace hashCode cache keys with collision-safe keys
acceptance_criteria: Cache keys are derived from canonical query/scope serialization and stable digest | Regression tests cover collision resistance and deterministic key generation | No cache-hit correctness regressions in query suite
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Replace hashCode-based cache keying with stable canonical serialization + cryptographic digest.

title: E20-S7: Reconcile roadmap source-of-truth and enforce in CI
acceptance_criteria: docs/backlog-jira-linear.csv is fully synced to `.beads/issues.jsonl` canonical rows | Roadmap status claims in docs align with validator output | Roadmap validation runs in CI and fails on row/status drift
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Reconcile `.beads`, backlog CSV, and docs status language; make drift a blocking CI failure.

title: E20-S8: Enforce kernel completion integrity policy
acceptance_criteria: Kernel run cannot auto-close issue with zero diff unless explicit no-op justification field is present | Gate summary records no-op classification and reason in telemetry | Policy has regression tests over events JSON fixtures
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Prevent silent no-op closure by enforcing non-zero diff or explicit no-op justification policy at completion time.

title: E20-S9: Converge active/integrated worktree delivery path
acceptance_criteria: Documented and scripted sync flow for master/main with compile + gate checks | Convergence report includes ahead/behind, conflict status, and module compile evidence | Nightly or per-wave sanity check prevents long-lived divergence
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Create a repeatable convergence workflow so `reverend` and `reverend-main` remain merge-compatible with shared gate outcomes.

title: E20-S10: Enforce kernel zero-diff/no-op completion contract
acceptance_criteria: Kernel completion path rejects zero-diff closes without explicit manifest no-op justification | Completion telemetry records classification (code_change vs noop) and justification source | Regression tests cover zero-diff close attempts and expected rejection/allow behavior
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Enforce completion-time policy so issues cannot auto-close with zero code/doc diff unless explicit no-op justification is present and auditable.

title: E20-S11: Telemetry anomaly guard + auto-reopen for false completions
acceptance_criteria: A reproducible command emits anomaly report over .cyntra/logs/events.jsonl for completion integrity checks | Issues with invalid completion evidence are auto-reopened or explicitly flagged for human review | Kernel runbook documents anomaly classes, reopen policy, and operator remediation flow
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Add an integrity monitor that scans completion telemetry for zero-diff or invalid gate patterns and reopens affected issues with evidence.

title: E20-S12: Enforce blocking gate skip-budget in completion policy
acceptance_criteria: Completion policy fails when blocking gates are skipped without allowlisted skip reason | Gate summary artifacts expose skipped gate counts/reasons per issue completion | Regression tests cover skip-budget pass/fail behavior with deterministic fixtures
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Prevent auto-close when blocking gates are skipped beyond policy budget; require explicit allowlisted reason and telemetry evidence.

title: E20-S13: Fix Codex workcell deadlock with heartbeat timeout + fail-fast recovery
acceptance_criteria: Kernel/workcell supervision detects prompt_sent stalls with configurable heartbeat timeout | Stalled runs fail with deterministic reason and do not auto-close issues as done | Runbook and telemetry include deadlock signature, kill/retry policy, and operator commands
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Add runtime supervision so workcells that remain at prompt_sent without progress are failed fast and automatically requeued with explicit reason codes.

title: E20-S14: Repair sleeptime evolution skill input contract regression
acceptance_criteria: sleeptime consolidation runs without SkillRunnerError for rollout-reflector input keys | Evolution invocation/tests enforce schema compatibility (rollout_paths/genome_id/reflection_depth) | Kernel logs no traceback during normal run cycles for this path
description: Type: Story. Epic: E20. Fix sleeptime evolution invocation so rollout-reflector input schema matches runtime payload and no runtime tracebacks occur during consolidation.

title: E21-S1: Build indexed query core (no full-program decompile on hot path)
acceptance_criteria: semanticSearch and similarity use indexed features for primary ranking path | Incremental index invalidation updates changed functions without full rebuild | Profiling artifacts show hot path no longer decompiles every function per query
description: Type: Story. Epic: E21. Replace O(N) query scan/decompile hot path with persisted index + incremental update strategy.

title: E21-S2: Integrate embedding-backed similarity/reranking in Reverend query service
acceptance_criteria: Similarity path uses embedding-backed scores with deterministic fallback mode | Evidence references and provenance survive API boundary into cockpit results | Integration tests verify ranking parity/delta on pinned fixtures
description: Type: Story. Epic: E21. Connect Reverend query API to embedding/reranking primitives from ML pipeline with deterministic fallback.

title: E21-S3: Wire cockpit search/evidence flows to live mission and proposal services
acceptance_criteria: Cockpit actions execute real mission/proposal/evidence service calls | Provider state reflects loading/error/success deterministically | Headless and UI parity tests cover mission/proposal interaction paths
description: Type: Story. Epic: E21. Deliver non-stub cockpit behavior with live proposal/evidence interactions and error-resilient UX states.

title: E21-S4: Add dynamic/static evidence overlays to query ranking and drilldown
acceptance_criteria: Query scores can incorporate dynamic evidence signals behind explicit weighting policy | Cockpit drilldown shows static+dynamic provenance links per hit | Regression tests verify deterministic output on pinned trace fixtures
description: Type: Story. Epic: E21. Merge trace/taint/hotpath evidence into ranking and cockpit evidence drilldown surfaces.

title: E21-S5: End-to-end cockpit mission loop with receipts and reversible apply flow
acceptance_criteria: Operator can execute query -> proposal -> review -> apply -> rollback from cockpit | Each mutation emits linked receipt artifacts with provenance chain | End-to-end scenario test reproduces same outputs across repeat runs
description: Type: Story. Epic: E21. Deliver the full operator loop from query to proposal review/apply/rollback with receipt chain evidence.

title: E21-S6: Add benchmark/latency quality gates for operational claim
acceptance_criteria: Benchmark slices measure ranking quality and operator workflow completion metrics | Gate/CI fails when regression exceeds configured threshold bands | Artifacts publish baseline-vs-current deltas with reproducible manifests
description: Type: Story. Epic: E21. Enforce measurable quality/latency thresholds for the operational assistant path in gates and CI.

title: E21-S7: Publish local operator runbook for SOTA assistant workflow
acceptance_criteria: Runbook covers prerequisites, launch, and verification commands | Troubleshooting section maps common failure signatures to remediations | Runbook validated by executing full flow from clean environment
description: Type: Story. Epic: E21. Document exact local setup, launch, mission execution, and troubleshooting for the in-Ghidra assistant flow.

title: E21-S8: GA readiness packet for "SOTA assistant inside Ghidra"
acceptance_criteria: Decision packet includes compile/gate/benchmark evidence with reproducible commands | Risk register disposition is explicit with owner signoff | Packet states operational criteria and links to all required artifacts
description: Type: Story. Epic: E21. Produce final go/no-go packet proving operational status with passing gates, benchmark lift, and risk disposition.
